review.title: Fuzzy Soft Set Based Classification for Gene Expression Data
review.abstract: Classification is one of the major issues in Data Mining Research fields. The classification problems in medical area often classify medical dataset based on the result of medical diagnosis or description of medical treatment by the medical practitioner. This research work discusses the classification process of Gene Expression data for three different cancers which are breast cancer, lung cancer and leukemia cancer with two classes which are cancerous stage and non cancerous stage. We have applied a fuzzy soft set similarity based classifier to enhance the accuracy to predict the stages among cancer genes and the informative genes are selected by using Entopy filtering.

metadata.title: Fuzzy Soft Set Based Classification for Gene Expression Data

sections.text: Index terms - entropy filter, fuzzy-soft-set-based classification, fuzzy-soft-set similarity, fuzzy-soft-set theory, soft-set theory and gene selection. 1 INTRODUCTION - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - gene expression represents the level of activation of a gene within an organism at a given time. Classification is the process of predicting classes using some machine learning algorithms in a single experiment. Classification of different tumour types in gene expression data is of great importance for cancer diagnosis and drug discovery, but is more complex due to its enormous size. DNA micro-array technologies have made it possible to measure the expression levels of thousands of genes in a single experiment. Several techniques are available to analyze gene expression profiles. A common feature of these techniques is the selection of a gene group for the subfixing process.

sections.heading: 2 RELATED WORK
sections.text: Soft set theory was initiated by Molodstov to solve some uncertainties among the data that are not solved by traditional mathematical tools. Maji et al. have further investigated the soft set theory and used this theory for some decision-making problems [3] [4]. They have also introduced the concept of soft set theory for decision-making problems. Aktas and Cagman have introduced the concept of soft groups [5]. P. Majumdar et al. [6] have introduced a general blurred soft set and they have studied the similarity of soft set for medical diagnosis to detect pneumonia in sufferers [6]. Recently, Milind M. Mushrif, et al. have introduced a new method for classifying natural textures using a blurred soft set classifier. Their new approach provides high accuracy in the classification of textures [7].

sections.heading: 3 RESEARCH MOTIVATION
sections.text: The biggest challenge in classifying gene expression data is its enormous size and inaccuracy. Many researchers try to achieve greater accuracy in gene classification by reducing or selecting the informative genes among thousands of genes. In cancer classification, researchers use some machine learning algorithms such as Support Vector Machines, Principal Component Analysis, etc., Rough Set Theory and Fuzzy Logic are only used for gene selection. In this paper, we use soft-set-based classification methods for cancer classification. In this algorithm, genes are selected for dimensionality reduction through entropy filtering, and genes are used for cancer classification based on their expression level of blurred soft-set-based classification methods.

sections.heading: 4 METHODOLOGY
sections.text: The methodology used in this paper is shown in Figure 1. In the first step, genes are pre-processed, in the second step informative genes are selected by entropy filtering and then fused on the basis of their expression value. In the fourth step, a blurred classification method based on soft-set.5 PRELIMINARIES

sections.heading: 8. 4 Validation measures:
sections.text: PrecisionPrecision is a measure of accuracy, provided that a specific class has been predicted [8]. It is defined by: Precision = tp / (tp + fp), where tp and fp are the number of truly positive and false positive predictions for the class under consideration.

sections.heading: Recall
sections.text: Recall is a measure of the ability of a predictive model to select instances of a particular class from a data set. It is also called sensitivity and corresponds to the true positive rate [8]. Recall / Sensitivity = tp / (tp + fn)

sections.heading: Specificity
sections.text: Recall / sensitivity is related to specificity, a measurement commonly used for two class problems where one is more interested in a particular class. Specificity is the true negative rate. Specificity = tn / (tn + fp)

sections.heading: Overall classification Accuracy
sections.text: Accuracy is the general correctness of the model and is calculated as the sum of the correct classifications divided by the total number of classifications [8].Accuracy = (True Classification) / (Total Number of Cases) Table 1,2 and 3 represents the performance analysis of the classification algorithms for lung cancer, leukemia and breast cancer datasets. Figure 5: Comparative analysis of the classification algorithms for gene expression datasets. Figure 8 shows the general accuracy of the classification algorithms. Table 1: Performance analysis for lung cancer gene expression datasets Figure 5: Comparative analysis of the classification algorithms for lung cancer datasets Accuracy measurements. Figure 8 shows the overall accuracy of the classification algorithms Fuzzy Soft Set Based Classifiction K-nearest Neighbor Approach Fuzzy KNN AlgorithmPrecision 0.79 0.65 0.65Sensitivity 0.85 Breficity Classification 0.8760.Specificity of Classification

sections.heading: 9. CONCLUSION
sections.text: Classification is the most important technique in microarray technology, which is used to predict classes between genes or samples. Prediction plays an important role in the biomedical field for predicting disease stages and drug discovery. In this paper, the classification technique is used to predict cancers between genes in different cancer gene expression datasets, such as the gene expression dataset for leukemia cancer with two classes of tumor and non-tumor, the gene expression dataset for lung cancer with two classes of tumor and the gene expression dataset for normal and breast cancer with two classes of benign and malignant. In this paper, the fuzzy soft set gene classification is used to classify gene expression data. The classification accuracy of the proposed approach is compared with the KNN and fuzzy KNN algorithms. Experimental analysis demonstrates the efficacy of the future unsharp set of data sets compared to other approaches.

metadata.abstractText: Abstract — Classification is one of the major issues in Data Mining Research fields. The classification problems in medical area often classify medical dataset based on the result of medical diagnosis or description of medical treatment by the medical practitioner. This research work discusses the classification process of Gene Expression data for three different cancers which are breast cancer, lung cancer and leukemia cancer with two classes which are cancerous stage and non cancerous stage. We have applied a fuzzy soft set similarity based classifier to enhance the accuracy to predict the stages among cancer genes and the informative genes are selected by using Entopy filtering.
